intro: Petrophile pulchella var. sessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, sessile leaves and clusters of pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or heathland environments. It is well adapted to arid conditions and can withstand periods of drought. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
